To Let Industrial/Distribution Units on a Design and Build basis. Units from 10,000 sq ft – 82,250 sq ft Located in East Yorkshire, the town of Howden is situated near the River Ouse and on the M62 providing easy access to the major regional cities of Leeds, Hull,Doncaster and York. The River Ouse provides an active trading route with the Port of Howden being one of the most active inland ports in the UK, 60 miles inland from the entrance to the Humber Estuary. This has meant that there is a strong industrial market in the local area. The site located just one mile from Junction 37, M62 and comprising a 6.5 acre development site, that provides the opportunity for the build of industrial/distribution units capable of accommodating units ranging in size from 10,000 – 82,250 sq ft. The development is extremely well located, not only providing direct access to the M62 via Boothferry Road, but also just two miles from Howden Port and Railway Station, providing local, regional and national access. The 6.5 acre development site has capacity for a minimum of 106,750 sq ft of new build warehousing. The adjacent Ozone scheme has attracted TNT, DPD, Warburtons and Alumasc. Indicative plans are provided to given an indication of what can be achieved The site can accommodate other configurations from 10,000 – 82,250 sq ft.
